text: Sir John Ernest Walker One or more of the preceding sentences incorporates text from the royalsociety.org website where: (born 7 January 1941) is a British chemist. He won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1997. Walker is Emeritus Director and Professor at the MRC Mitochondrial Biology Unit in Cambridge, and a Fellow of Sidney Sussex College, Cambridge. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1998. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:Living people Category:British chemists Category:People from West Yorkshire Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: John E. Walker
